description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve performance of the public procurement system progressively in Bangladesh, focusing largely on the target agencies. The PDO would be achieved by strengthening the ongoing reform process and moving it further along with the following outputs: (i) enhanced capacity in creating a sustained program to develop skilled procurement professionals, (ii) strengthened management and monitoring of procurement in target agencies, (iii) introduction of e-government procurement in CPTU and the target agencies on a pilot basis, and (iv) creation of greater public awareness of a well functioning public procurement system by engaging civil society, think tanks, beneficiaries, and the private sector. All these actions are key elements in effective implementation of the procurement law/ regulations.

participating-org.narrative: Implementation Monitoring and Evaluation Division (IMED), Central Procurement Technical Unit (CPTU)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A.1 | Description :Ensure continuity of services of existing key project officials(Director General & 3 Directors) for period as required for effective implementation of project | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A.1 | Description :Fill the vacant positions of CPTU (2 deputy directors, 1 assistantprogrammer, 2 computer operators) | Due Date :30-Sep-2013
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A.2 | Description :Establish e-GP cell by 4 target agencies with adequate staff andresources | Due Date :30-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A.4 | Description :Maintain (i) a Procurement Monitoring Coordinator in each targetagency; (ii) a Consultative Committee; (iii) Public-Private Stakeholders Committee | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A | Description :Maintain throughout project period the CPTU, e-GP cell in 4 targetagencies, Project Steering Committee and Public Private Stakeholders Committee | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.B | Description :Carry out governance and accountability action plan as approved by IDA |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.A | Description :Furnish to IDA semi annual Project Reports based on key performanceindicators | Frequency :SemiAnnual
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.B | Description :Furnish to IDA quarterly interim unaudited financial reports and annualfinancial audit reports | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B | Description :Provision allowing retroactive financing of eligible expendituresincurred after July 1, 2012 up to $2 million. Terms and conditions of disbursement against DLI-based expenditures uponsatisfactory evidence for compliance | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V | Description :Put in place and maintain arrangements satisfactory to IDA to ensure thate-GP system is self financed through a retention of e-GP generated revenues within IMED and/or through provision to IMED of otheradequate funds on an annual basis for management and O&M of e-GP system, with a distinct budget code and financial authority forIMED/ CPTU to spend such funds | Due Date :30-Sep-2013
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V, A.i | Description :Maintain CPTU with adequate staff, fully funded from revenue budget |Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V, A.iii | Description :Appoint a new DG, CPTU to IDA's satisfactio | Due Date :06-Mar-2008
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.B | Description :Appoint one more Director (e-GP/MIS) in CPTU | Due Date :11-Nov-2007
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.D | Description :Employ an implementation and capacity development consultant | Due Date:11-Dec-2007
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.F | Description :Employ a procurement reform implementation advisor | Due Date :11-Jun-2008
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.G.i | Description :Install and operationalize procurement performance monitoring systemin all four target agencies | Due Date :11-Dec-2009
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.G.ii | Description :Install e-GP in at least three target agencies | Due Date :11-Dec-2009
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.H | Description :Commence piloting e-GP in at least two target agencies | Due Date:11-Mar-2010
Finance Agreement :Schedule 3 | Description :Matrix containing all applicable DLI targets, periods, and amounts for each targetagency | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Number of e-GP awareness workshops in all districts (2013- 10, 2014- 20, 2015- 45, 2016- 64, 2017- 64))
Percentage of procuring entities of 20 additional agencies with one trained/ certified procurement staff (2013- 10%, 2014- 30%, 2015- 50%, 2016- 70%, 2017- 78%))
Number of weeks of procurement training delivered by local training institute (ESCB) with its own fund/ resources outside of PPRPIIAF (2013- 5, 2014- 25, 2015- 45, 2016- 55, 2017- 55))
Percentage of procuring entities of 20 additional agencies with one trained/ certified procurement staff (2013- 10%, 2014- 30%, 2015 - 50%, 2016- 70%, 2017- 78%)
Number of public sector agencies registered in the e-GP system
Percentage of complaints handled satisfactorily by four target agencies (2013- 35%, 2014- 45%, 2015- 55%, 2016- 70%, 2017- 72%)
Four target agencies expand electronic government procurement (e-GP) to all 64 districts using national competitive bidding procurem ent (2013- 10%, 2014- 35%, 2014- 60%, 2016- 80%, 2017- 83%))
Percentage of contract/ bid invited through e-GP by four target agencies using NCB in 64 districts (2013- 10%, 2014- 35%, 2015- 60%, 2016- 80%, 2017- 83%)
Expanding Government-contractors forum to all disitricts and holding semi-annual meetings (2013- 10, 2014- 20, 2015- 40, 2016- 64, 2017- 64))
Four target agencies publish PROMIS quarterly report covering 90% of bids invited/ contracts awarded (2013- 20%, 2014- 50%, 2015- 70%, 2016- 90%, 2017- 95%)
Four target agencies publish PROMIS quarterly report for monitoring of procurement performance covering 90% of bids invited/ contracts awarded annually (2013- 20%, 2014- 50%, 2015- 70%, 2016- 90%)
Number of Public-Private Stakeholders Committee (PPSC) workshops/ meetings held (2013- 7, 2014- 10, 2015- 12, 2016- 14, 2017- 14))
Percentage of contracts awarded within initial bid validity period by the 4 target agencies (2013- 68%, 2014- 73%, 2015- 78%, 2016-80%, 2017-82%)
Percentage of contract awards published by four target agencies in CPTU's website for awards above PPR specified threshold (2013- 75%, 2014- 80%, 2015- 85%, 2016- 90%, 2017- 91%))
